Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (450g) beef sirloin, thinly sliced
  • 4 tablespoons soy sauce
  • 4 tablespoons calamansi juice or lemon juice
  • 4 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 tablespoons brown sugar
  • 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper
  • 4 cups cooked Jasmine rice
  • 4 fried eggs
  • Vegetable oil for frying

Optional garnish: sliced tomatoes, cucumber, or atchara (pickled papaya)

Instructions:

  1. In a bowl, combine the soy sauce, calamansi juice (or lemon juice), minced garlic, brown sugar, and ground black pepper. Stir until the sugar is dissolved.

  2. Add the thinly sliced beef sirloin to the marinade and mix well, ensuring that the meat is coated evenly. Let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, or up to overnight for a more intense flavor.

  3. Heat a frying pan or skillet over medium-high heat and add a little vegetable oil.

  4. Remove the marinated beef from the refrigerator and fry it in the hot pan for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until cooked to your desired level of doneness. Set aside.

  5. In the same pan, fry the eggs according to your preference (sunny side up or over easy).

  6. To serve, place a portion of cooked Jasmine rice on a plate. Add a serving of the fried beef (tapa) beside the rice, and top it off with a fried egg (itlog).

  7. Garnish with sliced tomatoes, cucumber, or atchara (pickled papaya) if desired.

  8. Repeat the process for each serving.

  9. Enjoy your delicious Tapsilog breakfast while it's still warm!

Note: You can adjust the quantities of beef, rice, and eggs depending on your preference and the number of servings you wish to make. Feel free to add other side dishes or sauces, such as vinegar or chili garlic sauce, to enhance the flavors according to your taste.
